results.title: The Anti-Diabetic Drug Metformin Rescues Aberrant Mitochondrial Activity and Restrains Oxidative Stress in a Female Mouse Model of Rett Syndrome
results.text_hl: Present results provide evidence that systemic treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may represent a novel, repurposable therapeutic strategy for @<m>DISEASE_Rett_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015518 @@@RTT@@@.

citations.NLM: Zuliani I, Urbinati C, Valenti D, Quattrini MC, Medici V, Cosentino L, Pietraforte D, Di Domenico F, Perluigi M, Vacca RA, De Filippis B. The Anti-Diabetic Drug Metformin Rescues Aberrant Mitochondrial Activity and Restrains Oxidative Stress in a Female Mouse Model of Rett Syndrome J Clin Med. 2020 Jun 1;9(6):. PMID: 32492904
citations.BibTeX: @article{32492904, title={The Anti-Diabetic Drug Metformin Rescues Aberrant Mitochondrial Activity and Restrains Oxidative Stress in a Female Mouse Model of Rett Syndrome}, author={Zuliani I and Urbinati C and Valenti D and Quattrini MC and Medici V and Cosentino L and Pietraforte D and Di Domenico F and Perluigi M and Vacca RA and De Filippis B}, journal={J Clin Med}, volume={9}, number={6}}

results.title: Chronic treatment with the anti-diabetic drug metformin rescues impaired brain mitochondrial activity and selectively ameliorates defective cognitive flexibility in a female mouse model of Rett syndrome.
results.text_hl: A significant boost of @GENE_PPARGC1A @GENE_19017 @@@PGC-1alpha@@@-dependent pathways related to mitochondrial biogenesis and antioxidant defense occurs in the brain of @<m>DISEASE_Rett_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015518 @@@RTT@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ that received the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Urbinati C, Lanzillotta C, Cosentino L, Valenti D, Quattrini MC, Di Crescenzo L, Prestia F, Pietraforte D, Perluigi M, Di Domenico F, Vacca RA, De Filippis B. Chronic treatment with the anti-diabetic drug metformin rescues impaired brain mitochondrial activity and selectively ameliorates defective cognitive flexibility in a female mouse model of Rett syndrome. Neuropharmacology. 2023 Feb 15;224():109350. PMID: 36442649
